title: Ferrari has a 'long list' of concerns about 2021 rules
text:
Mattia Binotto has suggested that Formula 1 is in for a difficult meeting in Paris this week.

On Wednesday, the ten teams are meeting at the FIA's headquarters to discuss with the governing body and Liberty Media the proposed rules revolution for 2021.

Not all on board

The already-delayed deadline for finalisation of the regulations is 31 October, making this week's meeting the last real opportunity for agreement.

READ | Seidl thinks teams will agree to the 2021 rules

But it emerged at Suzuka that only four of the ten teams are currently willing to sign up for what is being proposed.

One of the dissenting voices is Ferrari's, and the Maranello team is also uniquely powerful in that it can controversially 'veto' any rule change in F1.

When asked at Suzuka about the six dissenting teams, team boss Binotto said: "That would be a very long conversation that has nothing to do with the race we have just had.

Issues to contend

"Let's just say that some controversial issues remain.

"We must preserve the essence of the sport, where teams receive the rewards they deserve. This is F1, not just a show.

"We have a rather long list of questions, but I don't think we should go into the details now," the Italian added.
description: Mattia Binotto has suggested that Formula 1 is in for a difficult meeting in Paris this week.
